intro: Pediomelum pentaphyllum, commonly known as the five-leafed pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. Pediomelum pentaphyllum is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
